1.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.
to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage
a craggy rock, literally or figuratively (a fortress)
properly, to twist or whirl (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to dance, to writhe in pain (especially of parturition) or fear; figuratively, to wait, to pervert
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.

2.brief: properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.
to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage

3.brief: to bend the knee; by implication, to sink, to prostrate
something born, i.e. a lad or offspring
to slice, i.e. break open or pierce

a rope (as twisted), especially a measuring line; by implication, a district or inheritance (as measured); or a noose (as of cords); figuratively, a company (as if tied together); also a throe (especially of parturition); also ruin
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)

4.brief: properly, to bind firmly, i.e. (by implication) to be (causatively to make) plump; also (through the figurative sense of dumbness) to dream
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
grain of any kind (even while standing in the field); by extension the open country
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

5.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
properly, chastisement, i.e. (by implication) a halter; figuratively, restraint
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve

6.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
a desert; especially (with the article prefix) the (generally) sterile valley of the Jordan and its continuation to the Red Sea
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
a residence (including a shepherd's hut, the lair of animals, figuratively, the grave; also the Temple); specifically, the Tabernacle (properly, its wooden walls)
properly, salted (i.e. land), i.e. a desert

7.brief: to laugh (in pleasure or detraction); by implication, to play
a noise, tumult, crowd; also disquietude, wealth
to drive (an animal, a workman, a debtor, an army); by implication, to tax, harass, tyrannize
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

8.brief: properly, what is left, i.e. (by implication) a gleaning
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
pasture (the place or the act); also the haunt of wild animals
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship

9.brief: to breathe after, i.e. (figuratively) to be acquiescent
to work (in any sense); by implication, to serve, till, (causatively) enslave, etc.
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to stop (usually over night); by implication, to stay permanently; hence (in a bad sense) to be obstinate (especially in words, to complain)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

10.brief: to tie, physically (gird, confine, compact) or mentally (in love, league)
something intwined, i.e. a string, wreath or foliage
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)

11.brief: figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.
near, with or among; often in general, to
toil; hence, a work, produce, property (as the result of labor)

12.brief: properly, to build up or support; to foster as a parent or nurse; figuratively to render (or be) firm or faithful, to trust or believe, to be permanent or quiet; morally to be true or certain;
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
seed; figuratively, fruit, plant, sowing-time, posterity
a threshing-floor (as made even); by analogy, any open area
to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.)

13.brief: an edge or extremity; specifically (of a bird or army) a wing, (of a garment or bedclothing) a flap, (of the earth) a quarter, (of a building) a pinnacle
to leap for joy, i.e. exult, wave joyously
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
the kind (maternal) bird, i.e. a stork
a pinion (or wing feather); often (collectively) plumage

14.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud

15.brief: to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively

16.brief: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
emptiness; figuratively, a worthless thing; adverbially, in vain
toil; hence, a work, produce, property (as the result of labor)
properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.
a (sudden) alarm (properly, the object feared, by implication, the feeling)

17.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to forget; figuratively, to neglect; causatively, to remit, remove
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be smooth (figuratively); by implication (as smooth stones were used for lots) to apportion or separate

18.brief: time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.
altitude, i.e. concretely (an elevated place), abstractly (elevation, figuratively (elation), or adverbially (aloft)
to rebel; hence (through the idea of maltreating) to whip, i.e. lash (self with wings, as the ostrich in running)
to laugh (in pleasure or detraction); by implication, to play
a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight)
to ride (on an animal or in a vehicle); causatively, to place upon (for riding or generally), to despatch

19.brief: to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight)
force (literally or figuratively); by implication, valor, victory
properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively
the back of the neck (as that on which burdens are bound)
the mane of a horse (as quivering in the wind)

20.brief: to undulate (as the earth, the sky, etc.; also a field of grain), particularly through fear; specifically, to spring (as a locust)
grandeur (i.e. an imposing form and appearance)
fright; concrete, an idol (as a bugbear)

21.brief: properly, to pry into; by implication, to delve, to explore
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
an encountering, accidental, friendly or hostile (also adverbially, opposite)
military equipment, i.e. (collectively) arms (offensive or defensive), or (concretely) an arsenal

22.brief: to laugh (in pleasure or detraction); by implication, to play
a (sudden) alarm (properly, the object feared, by implication, the feeling)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to prostrate; hence, to break down, either (literally) by violence, or (figuratively) by confusion and fear
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement

23.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a flash; figuratively, a sharply polished blade or point of aweapon
a lance (for thrusting, like pitching a tent)
properly, something to strike with, i.e. a dart

24.brief: commotion, restlessness (of a horse), crash (of thunder), disquiet, anger
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to build up or support; to foster as a parent or nurse; figuratively to render (or be) firm or faithful, to trust or believe, to be permanent or quiet; morally to be true or certain;
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a cornet (as giving a clear sound) or curved horn

25.brief: enough (as noun or adverb), used chiefly with preposition in phrases
a cornet (as giving a clear sound) or curved horn
remote, literally or figuratively, of place or time; specifically, precious; often used adverbially (with preposition)
properly, to blow, i.e. breathe; only (literally) to smell or (by implication, perceive (figuratively, to anticipate, enjoy)
a battle (i.e. the engagement); generally, war (i.e. warfare)
a head person (of any rank or class)
clamor, i.e. acclamation of joy or a battle-cry; especially clangorof trumpets, as an alarum

26.brief: a flower (from its brilliancy); also a hawk (from it flashing speed)
an edge or extremity; specifically (of a bird or army) a wing, (of a garment or bedclothing) a flap, (of the earth) a quarter, (of a building) a pinnacle
the south (as being on the right hand of a person facing the east)

27.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to soar, i.e. be lofty; figuratively, to be haughty
the eagle (or other large bird of prey)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
a nest (as fixed), sometimes including the nestlings; figuratively, a chamber or dwelling

28.brief: a craggy rock, literally or figuratively (a fortress)
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)
to stop (usually over night); by implication, to stay permanently; hence (in a bad sense) to be obstinate (especially in words, to complain)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a tooth (as sharp); specifically  ivory; figuratively, a cliff
a craggy rock, literally or figuratively (a fortress)
a net, or (abstractly) capture; also a fastness

29.brief: there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
properly, to pry into; by implication, to delve, to explore
remote, literally or figuratively, of place or time; specifically, precious; often used adverbially (with preposition)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care

30.brief: blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
